poem:
The White Lotus

In a room (Thai air ripe  
with dreams and discontent),  
a man inhales clouds—  
silver gas to free  
his lungs from grip of earth.  
His eyes, twin lakes,  
reflect sky and staff.  
Beyond glass, whispers  
of chaos and calm,  
a fragile dance, unseen,  
like the breeze that stirs  
the leaves outside.
